It was one of your exes, “Oh yeah, Tracey, Torie, Tina, yeah that’s it Tina, right?” You say, “Aww you remembered.” She says with a smile, “Yeah…so ah… how did you get in here?” you ask,

“Oh that’s not important, but you know Mike, you’re a jerk.” She says, changing her tone from friendly to serious. “What? Look I’m sorry it didn’t work out but…” you try to say but she cuts you off. “You didn’t let me finish, you’re an insensitive womanizing asshole, and were tired of it.” She says, “Wait what do you mean we?” you ask, “Well pretty much every woman you’ve ever met, and now it’s payback time.” She says with a somewhat sinister smile on her face.

“What?” you say with a confused look on your face, “Yeah you see, we have been given complete control over you, how you dress, where you work, what you eat, you get the idea.” She says

You then start laughing uncontrollably, “Wow, that’s a good one, I was worried there for a second.” You say as you turn around and walk out of the room, “Well it was good to see you. You know your way out right?”

Suddenly…

"Listen, we don't have a whole lot of time. I have a question for you: What are your feelings towards me right now?"

Mike thought for a moment before responding. "Well, at first I was so mad at what you were doing to me. You ruined my life! You made me a woman, and a heavily pregnant woman at that! I wanted to strangle you...but...after the support group meeting, I started thinking about things. I really have been a horrible human being. As a man, I was egocentric, self-centered, and overall, a prick. As difficult as today has been, when we got here and you were rubbing my feet, I felt a sense of peace I've never felt before. I want to thank you Tina for opening my eyes to the person I was and...I am truly sorry for what I put you through in the past."

Tina started sobbing. "That was the answer I was hoping for!" She threw her arms around Mike giving him a big hug. Mike hugged back.

"Here's the deal; there are 5 more women who are lined up to humiliate you and bend you to their will. Do you remember Donna?"

"Oh Jesus...yes I do."

"She is next. The way our powers work is, we have complete control over everything in your life but only for15 hours. After that, our powers go away and the next woman receives hers at the time she arranged for. I started mine at 6AM so as of about 10 minutes ago, my powers left. I know that Donna decided to start her powers at midnight and believe me, she has some seriously grotesque things lined up for you. Before I lost my powers I was able to make a few last second changes to you. Unfortunately, I could not revert what I already did. Your legs and back are much stronger than they were before which should make it easier for you to walk. I created a suitcase for you with a few women's maternity outfits and the last thing I was able to do was to change your drivers license to match you at this moment. Your name is now Stacy Jones. You are 5'8'' and are 25 weeks along with sextuplets...which are also bigger babies...sorry Stacy, I couldn't undo that."

Mike realized that now he responded to Stacy. "Why did you do all of that Tina? It's all going to change in a few hours anyway."

"Stacy, I am going to offer you a deal. Let's get out of here right now and run from Donna, as well as the other four women. Your life will be completely changed by what I did, but if Donna gets a hold of you...you may not ever recover."

Your body leaned forward, followed by a blast of air from the bus. "Mika. Come on, we're here" Allison says to you. She was the blonde-haired girl who had sat beside you. She was the utmost friendly. You couldn't quite determine what clique she belonged to. She didn't look preppy. She didn't look athletic. She wasn't nerdy. She fell somewhere in the middle. It was a perfect mix for anyone to be acquainted with. She seemed so familiar to you, like you had known her all your life. Layla, on the other hand, seemed to fit the glove of "prep" perfectly. She had brown hair like yours, except she had blonde highlights, and chomping away at a piece of gum. You didn't know how, but Allison and Layla were friends. Right now, it would be a good idea to stick with them.

"Mika!" Allison comes close to yelling. You had been staring out the window. You got up and sped away to catch up with them. You stepped off the bus and caught up with them. "Oh please, Allison. He is such a tool" is the first thing you overheard from Layla. You joined alongside them, on Allison's left. "I think he's sweet. You're always after all my boyfriends Layla" Allison counters. Layla bit down on her lower cheek. "I've seen him do this plenty of times. He just wants to be with you so he's with someone" Allison shrugged it off. "Mika. Did you have any boyfriends in Germany?" Layla was trying to bargain for support you assumed. You decided to lie and say "Yeah, quite a few." Layla's eyes narrowed. "Tell her, Allison. Tell her all about your little 'Prince Charming'"

Allison had a wicked grin on her face. "About two weeks ago, Michael, my boyfriend, asked me out. I was shocked. It was weird, he'd seldom talked to me before. Like anyone else, I went for it. I never knew he was so sweet and considerate. He has a reputation here though. A lot of people, like Layla" Layla was shaking her head in disagreement with everything Allison had said. "...Think he uses girls. Layla absolutely hates Michael." "Why do you hate Michael?" you interrupt. "I absolutely hate him. I used to be stupid. I actually dated him." Layla snaps. Layla's face straightened and she looked down at the sidewalk. "I actually dated him for 18 months. Then, one day, he calls me, like he usually did. At the end of the phone call he was acting strange. 'This is my last call' he said. I asked him what he meant. I saw him the next day. He was with a piece of trash, instead of me."

"Michelle! Michelle, it's me" she hisses. She giggles and whispers "Michelle, it's me Tina!" Somehow, Tina had managed to find a way to come with you. Her smile disappears when she looks up. You swivel head back around to see Mr. Roenick eying you. "Is there something you would like to share, Ms. Michelle?" You shake your head slowly 'no', Mr. Roenick continues to lecture the class.

Tina snaps her fingers and the world suddenly goes dark. You can't see anything but pitch-black darkness for a few seconds.

And then it begins.

It almost feels as if you are being ripped apart. You can see everything you had ever experienced in your entire life flash before you, including this morning. Almost as soon as a memory appears, it disappears as if it had never existed, causing intense pain within your cranium.

Hours, days, weeks, months, years of experience and memories are stripped away in instants as the spell takes effect. You try your hardest to hang onto your most precious memories: Graduation, your first car, your first job, losing your virginity, your first kiss, your first date, your thirteenth birthday party. These efforts are useless, as they are soon ripped away anyway.

Eventually, you can't remember anything at all. You have no sense of self, and it is almost like not existing at all.

Then it hits you like a speeding train. New memories begin replacing the old ones, memories of diapers and playing with dolls, of your mommy and most of all your new name, Michelle.

But that's always been your name.... hasn't it?

You open your eyes to look at your mommy. She's smiling, and although something seems off, you can't help but smile too.

You wonder why you were crying at all. Today's the happiest day of your life after all.

"Happy 5th birthday, Michelle!" your mommy shouts.

Giggling, you run up to her and hug her giant leg. Looking up into her eyes, you grin and say

"I wuv you mommy."

13312.content:
And from that moment on you assumed the life of a little girl, with all the memories of your original self gone, you now saw Tina as your loving mother, and she happily raised you as her own.

For twenty long years she made you willingly participate in every aspect of a girls early life; she bought you all the girly little outfits and toys, she put you in beauty pageants, swim lessons, ballet, girl scouts, gymnastics and any other activities she could think of.

And then when you went through your teenage years she bought you all kinds of girly and suggestive outfits to wear, she was there when you went through puberty, and you didn’t even notice the vengeful smile on her face when she took you down the “Woman’s section” of the pharmacy department or when you started wearing a bra. You didn’t even catch her subtle laughter every time you went up a cup size, you were in double D cups by the time you were sixteen.

And then you graduated high school and went to college, for some reason school came really easy to you, almost as though you had done it all before, but Tina would always say it was because you got your brains from her, though she always laughed when she said it.

College was a little harder but you stayed busy with all your extracurricular activities, you were in a several sports teams and in different organizations. Most of which either involved a tight or skimpy outfit like gymnastics or swimming, and clubs that raised awareness for women’s rights and feminism. You didn’t know why but it was almost as though you were drawn to stuff like that.

You were hot and smart, which got you plenty of male attention. But deep down something always felt kind of wrong about it. But you still had boyfriends from time to time, almost as though something was telling you to date them and then wouldn’t let you break up with them right away. You had experimented with other girls but it always seemed like after you did something bad would happen, like after your first time you gained extra weight on your butt, thighs, and belly overnight, and you couldn’t lose it for a month.

But now you are out of college, you have a great job, great friends, and it is your twenty-fifth birthday. You already enjoyed a surprise party earlier that day and now you are on your way to have dinner with your mother, Tina.

133121.content:
You entered your Mom's house with a sense of excitement. Your mom was a great cook, and she always made the best dinners for you when you came home on your birthdays. She always seemed more excited than usual on your special days, and it showed. Especially today. Something about her seemed different today. You couldn't tell exactly what it was but you just figured that she had just gotten herself a new boyfriend or something.

She greeted you warmly, with a grin seemingly plastered onto her face as she seated you at the table that had a delicious smelling feast laid on its ancient oak. Your mother sat across from you. She looked like she was ready to jump out of her seat at any second.

"So, Michelle, what's it like to be a girl?" she questioned.

You looked at her oddly. That was a strange question to ask someone.

" I... uh... enjoy it, I guess? Why wouldn't I?" you answered.

Her grin grew so wide it looked like it would tear her face in two.

"Do you like boys?" She asked .

"Of course," you said.You decided not to mention how weird it felt.... as if it was wrong somehow.

"Here's your present, Michelle. Happy twenty fifth birthday!" your mom announced in a sickeningly cheery tone as she placed a box in front of you.

You opened the box, only to find a tiny slip of paper with words written on it in blue ink.The words were 'Welcome back, Mike!'.

You glared at your mother.

"Is this some kind of joke? Who the hell is Mike and where's my present?"

She giggled."You are, of course. Don't you remember? Oh, that's right. Here's your real present," she said as she snapped her fingers.

It hit you like a train. Memories rushed back into your head. You were Mike Brown, Ladies Man. But you were also Michelle Westfield, the daughter of Tina Westfield.... who, confusingly enough, was also one of your ex-girlfriends.

"Oh my god.... I can't believe this!! You actually turned me into a girl and raised me for twenty years. But of course you did... you're my mom after all. NO!!! You're one of my ex-girlfriends and I'm sorry for what I did to you! Please, change me back!" You yelled, your thoughts muddled and confused.

"That's not like you Mike, not at all. Then again, you aren't exactly Mike, are you now, Michelle?"

"No, mom. I mean Tina. I mean mom, of course."

"Hmmm...." Tina mused. "I could keep you like this, and torture you more, but I know you've changed, and now you'll think twice before cheating on a girl you're with, and leaving them constantly. Maybe I should forgive you. Then again, I can still have so much more fun with you."

"Please...." You begged, getting down on your knees with tears streaming down your face.

Tina looked down at you, first condescendingly, and then lovingly.

Maybe she would finally forgive you.

Or maybe she would make the torture worse than ever.
